definition: to be attacked by an assassin
thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder

sentences.english: Leon Trotsky was assassinated near Mexico City.
sentences.chinese: 托洛斯基在墨西哥城附近遇刺。

sentences.english: But, the prospect of a U. S. -Soviet mission to the Moon died with Kennedy.
sentences.chinese: 但肯尼迪的遇刺讓合作計劃很快胎死腹中。

sentences.english: President J. F. K. was assassinated.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼迪總統是遇刺身亡的。

sentences.english: The assassination of archduke ferdinand started off the first world war.
sentences.chinese: 斐迪南大公的遇刺引發了第一次世界人戰。

sentences.english: He said they have agreed to cooperate on contributing to the national investigations regarding the assassination of Rabbani.
sentences.chinese: 他說這兩國將合作調查拉巴尼遇刺事件。

sentences.english: Regardless, the stabbing has had caused unease among journalists in the city.
sentences.chinese: 然而，李翔遇刺身亡的確引起了記者界的不安。

sentences.english: The assassination of the archduke triggered the war.
sentences.chinese: 大公爵遇刺觸發了戰爭。

sentences.english: Six people have been killed by stabbing on the island of Jersey in the English Channel.
sentences.chinese: 有六個人在英吉利海峽上的澤西島遇刺身亡。

sentences.english: The news of the president's assassination rocked the nation.
sentences.chinese: 總統遇刺的消息震驚全國。

sentences.english: When I heard of his assassination, I couldn't believe it.
sentences.chinese: 當我聽說他遇刺後，感到難以置信。

sentences.english: Republican presidential contenders were also quick to react to the Bhutto killing.
sentences.chinese: 共和黨競選人也就貝布托的遇刺事件很快作出迴應。

definition: to assassinate/(military) to fight with a bayonet/(baseball) to put out (a baserunner)
mutiny/(Tw) to be dumped by one's girlfriend while serving in the army
to break a prisoner out of jail
call in (one's subordinates)/summon (an envoy of a foreign country) to an interview
to commit suicide to escape punishment
to kill secretly/to stab in the back
